content.description: Starts off with a nice boulder problem right off the ground. Followed by an awkward mantle.  Then choose between an uncomfortable no hands mantle or a big move up high left.  One more big move gets you up to the juggy finish.
content.protection: 6 bolts with chains at the top.
content.location: Just to the left of La Aspiration

climbs.name: Rat's Nest
climbs.fa: FFA Todd Hamm   equipped by Dave Stephens

content.description:
Deceptively steep and strenuous.  The physical crux comes early, but it's not in the bag until you've mastered the psychological crux at the end.

Watch your rope position as you make the last moves to the chains.  It would be easy to step over the rope and end up with the rope behind your leg (bad if you fall).  Not a problem if you're mindful.

Best to skip the first bolt by third-classing up easy jugs to the right.
content.protection: 7 bolts (6 clips if you skip the first); lowering hooks at anchor.
content.location: Right side of Pack Rat Cave

content.description: Follow the obvious left leaning jug rail. An awkward start leads to steep climbing on good holds.
content.protection:
Bolts to lower-offs at the anchor.

Trad Option: Skip all the bolts by placing good cams. Doubles from .3-.5 and a single .75.

content.description:
Arden aided it, Rich bolted it and Alex sent it!

Description from Alex's blog: "I settled on grading it 5.13c, its not an easy climb and is very beta intensive, some clips are awkward and rely on some interesting footwork. However this is one of my favorite routes yet, in my eye's it has a little bit of everything and when you climb it really flows." Alex has since passed away.
Climb a steep flake to a mantle past the first bolt. Then the route traverses right a couple feet on good holds. After that, it's a series of hard mantles moving towards the anchors.
content.protection: bolted with chains at the top
